Class Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • Clock

  • public class Clock
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Justin Chiang

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int elapsedSec 
      private int hour 
      private int min 
      private int sec 
      private java.lang.String timeOfDay 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Clock()
      Constructs a new instance of a Clock object with the hour, minutes, and seconds set to zero, and the time of day set to AM
      Clock(int hour, int min, int sec, java.lang.String timeOfDay)
      Constructs a new instance of a Clock object with the hour, minutes, seconds and time of day set to the specified values
      Clock(int hour, int min, java.lang.String timeOfDay)
      Constructs a new instance of a Clock object with the hour, minutes, and time of day set to the specified values

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String displayTime()
      Returns a string of a Clock object's current time with the format hour:min:sec timeOfDay
      int getElapsedSec()
      Returns the number of elapsed seconds of a Clock object since its start time
      int[] getTime()
      Returns an integer array containing in order the hour, minute, and second values of a Clock object
      void setElapsedSec(int elapsedSec)
      Sets a Clock object's number of elapsed seconds to the specified value
      void setTime(int hour, int min, int sec, java.lang.String timeOfDay)
      Sets a Clock object's hour, minute, and second values to the specified values
      void updateTime()
      Increments a Clock object's second value and number of elapsed seconds by 1

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Clock

        public Clock()
        Constructs a new instance of a Clock object with the hour, minutes, and seconds set to zero, and the time of day set to AM

      • Clock

        public Clock(int hour,
             int min,
             java.lang.String timeOfDay)
        Constructs a new instance of a Clock object with the hour, minutes, and time of day set to the specified values
        Parameters:
        hour - the hour value of the clock
        min - the minute value of the clock
        timeOfDay - the time of the day (AM or PM) of the clock

        Parameters:
        hour - the hour value of the clock
        min - the minute value of the clock
        sec - the second value of the clock
        timeOfDay - the time of the day (AM or PM) of the clock

        Returns an integer array containing in order the hour, minute, and second values of a Clock object

      • setTime

        public void setTime(int hour,
                    int min,
                    int sec,
                    java.lang.String timeOfDay)
        Sets a Clock object's hour, minute, and second values to the specified values
        Parameters:
        hour - the hour value to set the clock to
        min - the minute value to set the clock to
        sec - the second value to set the clock to
        timeOfDay - the time of day (AM or PM) value to set the clock to
